title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Cape Cod crash involving an e-bike has sparked debate over Massachusetts' e-bike regulations and safety concerns.
78% of over 580 readers support stricter e-bike laws in Massachusetts, while 20% oppose and 2% are unsure.
Current Massachusetts e-bike law divides bikes into Class 1 and Class 2, allowing speeds up to 20 MPH without licenses.

title: Watch: Dog rescued from Ted Williams Tunnel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A dog entered the Ted Williams Tunnel and was rescued by Massachusetts State Police on Thursday morning.
MassDOT surveillance video captured the dog trotting toward oncoming traffic before a trooper halted vehicles for the rescue.
The incident occurred near the East Boston side of the tunnel, and the dog was safely retrieved after initially evading capture.

title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Canterbury Farm in Becket, operated by Linda and Dave Bacon, closes after 40 years due to retirement.
The farm offered cross-country skiing, B&B lodging, and summer activities on its historic 200-acre property.
Challenges including climate change and increased Airbnb competition affected business in recent years.

title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Patriots' Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss will miss Sunday's game against the Buccaneers due to injuries.
Rookie TreVeyon Henderson and veteran Terrell Jennings are expected to lead the Patriots' backfield with Stevenson out.
Patriots face additional challenges without key defensive player Christian Elliss, who is second on team in tackles.

title: Is Drake Maye the MVP? Execs don’t think so, but several analysts do.
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye leads the Patriots to a 7-2 start with top passing stats, sparking MVP discussions.
NFL executives show limited support for Maye as MVP; he received only one vote in a 42-executive poll.
Analysts praise Maye's performance; some argue his success amid limited talent elevates his MVP case.

title: Who makes the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader recommendations for the best espresso martinis in Greater Boston.
Readers can submit favorite espresso martini spots via a form or email for a future guide.
Espresso martinis are popular in Boston, with variations featuring coconut and burnt sugar.

title: Travelers face delays, cancellations at Logan Airport after FAA names it among airports impacted by the shutdown
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport experiences 107 delays and 38 cancellations Friday due to the FAA's 10% air traffic reduction amid government shutdown.
Logan is among 40 high-volume U.S. airports affected by reduced air traffic, impacting travelers' plans across New England.
Massport advises travelers to check with airlines for updates, urging caution as some passengers seek alternatives or cancel flights.

title: 10 noteworthy stats after a month of hockey for 2025-26 Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins reduced their expected goals against to 1.89 per 60 minutes, ranking third in the NHL's recent games.
With Hampus Lindholm in the lineup, the Bruins boast a 7-1-0 record, significantly improving their penalty kill success.
Morgan Geekie leads with 10 goals in 16 games, tied with Pastrnak for most goals since Nov. 2024 despite chemistry drop.

title: More Massachusetts residents say their finances are in poor shape, UMass poll finds
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A UMass Amherst/WCVB poll shows Massachusetts residents report record financial concerns with 21% rating finances as 'poor'.
Housing, economy, and cost of living are top concerns; financial confidence lowest since survey's inception in 2021.
64% of residents support keeping the current state flag, while majority favor restrictions on cell phones in schools.

title: Fitchburg police defend actions during ICE arrest after man appears to seize while holding child
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Federal immigration officials detained Juliana Milena Ojeda-Montoya in Fitchburg, alleging her violent criminal past.
During the arrest, her husband appeared to have a seizure, but emergency personnel reported no legitimate medical episode.
Fitchburg police were called to maintain order after a crowd gathered, ensuring the safety of federal agents and the public.
